unittitle.value: <emph render="italic">The Civil, Political, Professional and Ecclesiastical History and Commercial and Industrial Record of the County of Kings and the City of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1683 to 1884</emph> by Henry R. Stiles

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
One copy of 
                <emph render="italic">The Civil, Political, Professional and Ecclesiastical History and Commercial and Industrial Record of the County of Kings and the City of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1683 to 1884</emph> by Henry Reed Stiles, published by W.W. Munsell & Co. in 1884. The volume is in poor condition; it has been disbound and some page are torn. Also included is a set of portraits of prominent 19th century Brooklynites from Stiles's volume, some of which have been mounted and framed with matting.

p.value: Researchers should exercise caution when using the volume due to its fragile condition.

Identification of item, date (if known); 
                <emph render="italic">The Civil, Political, Professional and Ecclesiastical History and Commercial and Industrial Record of the County of Kings and the City of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1683 to 1884</emph> by Henry R. Stiles, 2004.021, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
GIft of Meyer, Suozzi, English & Klein, P.C., and Brian Michael Seltzer, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 2004.

Henry Reed Stiles (1832-1909) was a physician who authored a number of historical and genealogical works in the second half of the nineteenth and into the early twentieth centuries, including the 3 volume 
                <emph render="italic">A History of the City of Brooklyn</emph> (1867-1870). Though his medical career took him to places as disparate as Dundee, Scotland and Woodbridge, New Jersey, Stiles lived most of his life in New York City and in Brooklyn. He was a founder of the Long Island Historical Society (now the Brooklyn Historical Society) in 1863 and served as the Society's first librarian. Further biographical information on Stiles can be found at his Wikipedia entry: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Reed_Stiles.

One copy of 
                <emph render="italic">The Civil, Political, Professional and Ecclesiastical History and Commercial and Industrial Record of the County of Kings and the City of Brooklyn, N.Y. from 1683 to 1884</emph> by Henry Reed Stiles, published by W.W. Munsell & Co. in 1884. The volume is in poor condition; it has been disbound and some page are torn. Also included is a set of portraits of prominent 19th century Brooklynites from Stiles's volume, some of which have been mounted and framed with matting.
